# preferredStyle

**Instance Property**

The preferred display style for the switch.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var preferredStyle: UISwitch.Style { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to specify the display style that you prefer. If the style changes, the switch may generate a layout pass to update the display.

The default style is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/Style-swift.enum/automatic]. For a list of styles, see [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISwitch/Style-swift.enum].

## Setting the display style

- **Displaying a checkbox in your Mac app built with Mac Catalyst**: Present a switch control as a Mac-style checkbox when your app runs in the Mac user interface idiom.
- **style**: The display style for the switch.
- **UISwitch.Style**: Styles that determine the appearance of the switch.
- **title**: The title displayed next to a checkbox-style switch.
